Terbaik di Dunia, Apa Istimewanya Keju Rogue River Blue?
04 Nov 2019, 05:35 by Tempo.co, Mila Novita
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Rogue River Blue dari Oregon, Amerika Serikat, dinobatkan sebagai pemenang dalam World Cheese Awards 2019. Ini pertama kali keju asal Amerika Serikat memenangkan gelar bergengsi ini, mengalahkan produk dari Italia yang jadi langganan juara.
Keju ini terbuat dari susu sapi organik dan diproduksi oleh Rogue Creamery di Rogue Valley, Oregon selatan. Dilansir dari The Independent, Ahad, 3 November 2019, proses pembuatan keju ini dikatakan cukup ketat. Sebelum dibungkus dengan daun anggur Syrah organik yang telah direndam dalam liqueur pir, keju ini harus berusia 9 – 11 bulan.
Juri kompetisi Bruno Cabral menggambarkan Rogue River Blue memiliki banyak rasa. Ia memuji keju ini memiliki sensasi berbeda, keseimbangan, dengan sedikit rasa manis dan pedas. Berkat rasanya yang unik, keju ini mengalahkan 16 finalis dari Italia, Swiss, Prancis, Italia, dan Inggris.
Pemenang kedua di perlombaan yang sudah berlangsung 32 tahun itu adalah keju parmesan berusia 24 bulan dari Italia. Sementara tempat ketiga diberikan keju susu sapi betina mentah dari Spanyol.
John Farrand, direktur pelaksana Guild of Fine Food, penyelenggara World Cheese Awards, mengatakan Rogue Creamery telah menjadi yang terdepan dalam revolusi keju artisan AS selama beberapa tahun. “Jadi tampaknya sangat tepat bagi mereka untuk menjadi pemenang Amerika pertama dari kejuaraan dunia ini," kata dia.

Best in the World, What's so special about Rogue River Blue Cheese?
Nov 04 2019, 05:35 by Tempo.co, Mila Novita
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Rogue River Blue from Oregon, United States, has been named the winner of the 2019 World Cheese Awards. This is the first time that cheese from the United States has won this prestigious title, beating products from Italy that are subscribed to champions.
This cheese is made from organic cow's milk and is produced by Rogue Creamery in Rogue Valley, southern Oregon. Reporting from The Independent, Sunday, November 3, 2019, the process of making cheese is said to be quite strict. Before wrapped in organic Syrah grape leaves that have been soaked in pear liqueur, this cheese must be 9-11 months old.
Competition judge Bruno Cabral described Rogue River Blue as having many flavors. He praised this cheese has a different sensation, balance, with a little sweet and spicy. Thanks to its unique taste, this cheese defeated 16 finalists from Italy, Switzerland, France, Italy and England.
The second winner in the 32-year race was 24-month-old parmesan cheese from Italy. While the third place is given raw female cow's milk cheese from Spain.
John Farrand, managing director of the Guild of Fine Food, organizer of the World Cheese Awards, said Rogue Creamery has been at the forefront of the US artisan cheese revolution for several years. "So it seems very appropriate for them to become the first American winners of this world championship," he said.
